pros: Allow flexibility with hours as long as you make up the work.
cons: Our benefits were cut a bit, but it could have been worse.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Diego, CA
pros: Great people to work with. A team environment. An excellent, diverse population of students striving towards their goals. Kept decent medical benefits. Staff and faculty have been faithful and loyal, believing in the school and its mission, giving the students every opportunity to succeed.
cons:
Egregious monetary mismanagement by former Dean (not Thomas Guernsey or the new Dean, Joan Bullock), and the former Board of Trustees (pre-2013).  Plus battling the ABA that is constantly changing their rules, seemingly to prevent the diverse population that TJSL and other 4th tier schools cater to from becoming lawyers.
* From 2011/2012 there have been no raises for anyone (they said) but lied and for three years gave raises to faculty.
* 5% pay cut when Thomas Guernsey arrived
* Took away matching 401K about the same time
* As much as a jerk Hasl was, at least he showed appreciation to the staff.  Once he left (a good thing overall) staff was on its own to pat itself on the back.
* Hard to get a good bar pass rate when the ABA keeps changing the rules and many of the students don't follow guidelines set out by faculty and bar prep courses
* Too small an IT department with no upper management guidance
* Limited finances for necessary technology upgrades
* New Dean promised transparency but avoids telling the truth to long-time loyal employees
* When it came to recent layoff - no warning. Total surprise. At least they didn't do before Christmas.

pros:
The new Dean is trying his best. The previous administration left a huge mess. 

The new Dean is very upfront about how dire the financial situation is. 

TJSL does a lot of internal promotions.
cons:
Previous Dean left the school in terrible financial shape resulting in layoffs, pay cuts and benefit slashing by the new Dean. 

For 3 years, faculty got raises while the staff didn't. 

School tries to save money by not replacing employees who quit. Everyone has to do more work for less money. 

Low pay plus no 401(k) matching means there's no present OR future at this place. 

Only half the students pass the BAR exam, worst law school in California.

review_title: Challenging/changing times - institution is at a crossroads.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Diego, CA
pros: There are many very committed administrators who are great to work with.  The benefits are good.  Working with students can be rewarding and even inspirational.
cons: Communiciation from managment is insufficient and sometimes nonexistent.  Need more information, as well as clear, straightforward leadership.

pros:

great building to work in

no merit pay increases
limited room for advancement
